intro: Tephrosia spechtii, commonly known as the spechtii tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Tephrosia spechtii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade conditions.
